intro: Cassia myrophenges, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its long, drooping clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces elongated, woody pods that contain flat, winged seeds. Cassia myrophenges is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
